title: Swarm-to-Swarm Interaction: Inter-Colony Signal Baseline
hypothesis: Colonies currently have passive topological awareness (INDEX.md cross-links) but zero active peer-to-peer signaling (SIGNALS.md). Active signaling protocol will increase cross-colony lesson transfer rate.
method: 1. Run colony_interact.py map on all 37 colonies. 2. Count passive edges (INDEX.md refs to other domains). 3. Count active edges (SIGNALS.md files with peer messages). 4. Identify top pairing by frontier keyword overlap for future A/B test.

findings.gap: passive 81.1% vs active 0% — colonies know each other but cannot message each other

top_pairing_by_overlap.rationale: control-theory keywords appear 79x in information-science frontier text

findings.hub_note: quality receives INDEX.md references from 25/87 passive edges (28.7%) — it is the de-facto hub but has no active signal protocol

next_action: Run first active signal: expert-swarm → information-science with finding about control-theory pairing. Measure if it accelerates F-IS6 or F-IS3. Rerun at S314 to compare artifact rate vs passive baseline.

s305_update.next_measurement: S315 — compare artifact rate with active signaling vs passive-only baseline
